para.p:
For a nonempty set
I

⁢ K
( I )
denote the family of finite nonempty subsets of

. We speak in this section about projective families of probability measures.

The following theorem shows how to construct a projective family from a Markov semigroup on a measurable space and a probability measure on this measurable space. 10 footnote 10 10 footnote 10 Heinz Bauer, Probability Theory, p. 314, Theorem 36.4.

Let
= I
R
≥
0

∈ J

( I )
